criteria.A: Five (or more) of the following symptoms present during the same 2-week period; at least one of the symptoms is either (1) depressed mood or (2) loss of interest or pleasure.
symptoms: Depressed mood most of the day, nearly every day
Markedly diminished interest or pleasure in all, or almost all, activities
Significant weight loss or weight gain, or decrease or increase in appetite
Insomnia or hypersomnia nearly every day
Psychomotor agitation or retardation nearly every day
Fatigue or loss of energy nearly every day
Feelings of worthlessness or excessive or inappropriate guilt
Diminished ability to think or concentrate, or indecisiveness
Recurrent thoughts of death, suicidal ideation, or suicide attempt
criteria.B: Symptoms cause clinically significant distress or impairment in functioning
criteria.C: Episode not attributable to physiological effects of a substance or medical condition
criteria.D: Occurrence not better explained by other psychotic disorders
criteria.E: No history of manic or hypomanic episode

severity.mild: Few symptoms beyond minimum criteria, mild impairment
severity.moderate: Symptoms or functional impairment between mild and severe
severity.severe: Most symptoms present, marked interference with functioning
